channel.title: Building A Computer
channel.description:
Hi i currenty got interested in building my own computer and i want it to have around 180gb of harddrive and 4 gb of ram and basically i want to totally pimp it out so its mega fast and has everything on it :D
I currently have 600 dollars and need to make more but i am only 14 and cannot get a job
I have been thinking about selling my rs account which is pretty decent and i also have about 5mil which i was also gunna sell.
If anyone has any other money making strategies that i can do... ive also been working on making scripts i could sell for rs money that i cuold later sell to my friends
If anyone has any suggestions about making money or what parts to put in please tell me
And please no posts saying your not old enough its too hard youll never be able to do it bc i dont care what you think and i can do it!!!

item.title: Building A Computer
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:96108”][quote author=deoxys505 link=topic=138207.msg1332229#msg1332229 date=1179451451]

I really don’t think that you can even find a 4GB RAM. The best I seen was just 2.5GB on the market. At 2GB the pc runs pretty good at that point, your pc probably wont run because it wont be able to recognice the RAM…

2.5gb that it? i have seen 4gb ram and the lastest motherboards hold 37gb ram right? and i got a big idea!!! moparisthebest with his big brain should right a tut on building your own computer
[/quote]lol…um…i don’t think that mopar built his own computer…maybe formatted it and put linux on it, but thats not hard to do (considering that i too have done it). Anyway, just work and work and if you get lucky you will get a break. Also, just use Google to find tutorials for building your own computer…

I’ll post a link or two:

The Benefits
The Step 1: Required Materials

If you want to start building, once you get the parts, there is the tutorial…

P.S. unless you want the entire tutorial, those are the beginner links…

mopar did build his own computer, as did i, its a very simple process, and its also very cheap and reliable.[/quote]Yeah, i just read the first page, and i just saw that he did…I just started posting a tutorial in the tutorial section on How to Build Your Own Computer

Read full topic

item.title: Building A Computer
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Do chores, ask if a friend would help you. Mow lawns (it’s also a good physical activity and couldn’t hurt you for the excersize.) Don’t buy crap or waste money on lollies. If you see 10cents, why not take it? It get’s you close. I did that for a year, and got $387 in Australian Currency.

Read full topic

item.title: Building A Computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

lothy:

I don’t think you’ll get a good PC for anything less then the $1500 mark.

I built my computer for $550 US dollars over 6 months ago, and I would call it at least ‘good’

2x512 667mhz dual channel RAM
Intel core 2 duo E6400 (still makes me gag that I bought an intel instead of AMD)
MSI mobo (I can look up the exact one if anyone wants)
BFG Nvidia 7600GT w/ 256mb overclocked RAM PCIexpress x16
some sweet looking case with a 550w psu
250gb SATA2 hd (I already had the rest of my harddrives)

Not too shabby for $550 I don’t think, got it all from newegg.com

edit: If you are wondering how it runs games, I can run every game I have tried on max settings with the exception of Quake 4’s ultra quality, which takes 256mb of RAM for textures. I have ran these games (and many more) on max settings:

Battlefield 2142
Doom 3
CS Source and various other Source-based games
Command and Conquer 3 Tiberium Wars

Read full topic

item.title: Building A Computer
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

lothy:

I don’t think you’ll get a good PC for anything less then the $1500 mark.

You can build a pretty good PC for around ~$1100, assuming you build it. It won’t be “top of the line” but it will run the latest games fairly well on medium settings. Now is a great time to buy too, you can purchase AMD processors, RAM, and DirectX9 video cards for pretty damn cheap atm.

Also, as frank_ said, 4GB of RAM is useless, odds are your OS won’t even recognize more than 3GB, unless you plan on going 64bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Building A Computer
item.dc:creator: @kilermage3 kilermage3
item.description:
@kilermage3 wrote:

Well I was looking to build a computer for my self too, but I went and added all the money for what I wanted to get and I needed a nice amount around $900. What I bought 2.80GHz processor=$300 or $400, 2GB of RAM=$133, 500GB=$120, New Geforce 7900-256MB graphics card=$70 or $120, and a windows xp genuine(wista not good)=$120…so as you can see thats a damn lot of money. But for the stuff you want to buy should be around $300 or $400.

Read full topic

I think mopar should buy a server to host this website. god knows how much bandwidth he would need and he would have no limits to what he could get
